activities.loc: Waushara Co. Courthouse 2nd Floor Room 230, Branch 1

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Neglecting a Child (Specified Harm Did Not Occur)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ryan T. Renner

records.addlTxt: BOND APPLICABLE TO BOTH CASES 22CF202 & 22CF203.  The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.

22CF202 & 22CF203 Cases called @ 1:23 PM Defendant Ryan T. Renner appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Morgan Rae appeared by video for Ryan T. Renner.  Attorney Matthew R. Leusink in court for State of Wisconsin. Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and potential punishment.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel. Defendant will be represented by SPD. Bond argument by DA Leusink. Bond argument by Atty Rae. Court orders $3000 Cash Bond. IA Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.
Initial appearance scheduled for November 29, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Initial appearance on November 29, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
